PathFinder module¶

PathFinder module for handling remote control, upgrade, and RESTful API communication.

  • Schema class is holding the Swagger schema retrieved from the PathFinder server, with potential patches to the schema.
  • PathFinderSUT class is for hadnling PathFinder upgrades.
  • PathFinder class wrapps the RESTful / Swagger API calls to the PathFinder server under test.

All objects are having sane defaults, to allow easy usage in San-Bruno lab environment. This means that in SB lab, calling most functions should “just work” as-is, but porper configuration variables should be applied elsewhere. Please see below for more details.

class qe_modules.PathFinder.PathFinder(host=None, JWT_alg=None, JWT_Header=None, JWT_mac=None, JWT_iss=None, JWT_sub=None, JWT_aud=None, JWT_qedp=None, JWT_exp=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

PathFinder Swagger client, with support for JWT authentication.

get_token and get_token_with_options are provided as statuc methods, and do not require class instance.

empty_options = {}¶
get_PathFinder_schema(host=None, patchFile=None)[source]¶

Get latest PF schema from SUT.

Update schema per patch file, if specified.

get_schema_objects(host=None, patchFile=None)[source]¶

Get all object definitions from schema.

Calls self.get_PathFinder_schema, and then Returns a swagger client. Keeps schema in class instance method .schema.

static get_secure_token(JWT_alg='HS256', JWT_Header='Bearer %s', JWT_mac='This_is_a_Test_QED_MAC_Key_Which_Needs_to_be_at_Least_32_Bytes_Long', JWT_iss='default', JWT_sub='admin@automation-pf03.qumu.media.com', JWT_aud='qed:default', JWT_qedp=['s', 'c', 'g', 'p', 'd', 'm', 'a'], JWT_exp=None)[source]¶

Generate JWT header token for communication with PathFinder API.

get_token(secure=None, returnResponse=False, JWT_alg=None, JWT_Header=None, JWT_mac=None, JWT_iss=None, JWT_sub=None, JWT_aud=None, JWT_qedp=None, JWT_exp=None)[source]¶

Generate token for communication with PathFinder API.

By defauly this code will try to figure out if a secure token is required. Behavior can be tuned via:

secure (~bool) - change to True or False to force secure/not-secure token.
by default, None, which translate to auto-detect.
returnResponse (bool) - when True, return tuple of swagger response
and requests object. Default is False, which returns only swagger response.

JWT_* (string) - Update PathFinder authorization configuration.

static get_token_with_options(JWT_alg='HS256', JWT_Header='Bearer %s', JWT_mac='This_is_a_Test_QED_MAC_Key_Which_Needs_to_be_at_Least_32_Bytes_Long', JWT_iss='default', JWT_sub='admin@automation-pf03.qumu.media.com', JWT_aud='qed:default', JWT_qedp=['s', 'c', 'g', 'p', 'd', 'm', 'a'], JWT_exp=None)[source]¶

Combine Swagger client request options with JWT security options.

This will result in swagger response tuple that contains both “regular” swagger response as well as the the undelying requests object.

print_schema_tree(host=None, patchFile=None)[source]¶

Print schema tree structure, showing call methods vs schema path.

class qe_modules.PathFinder.PathFinderSUT(PF_Hudson='build2:8080', PF_Branch='DeliveryService_1.3', PF_Type='qed-server')[source]¶

Bases: object

Helper class to deal with PathFinder SUT (System Under Test) upgrades.

Class is initialized with the PathFinder IP address (or DNS entry).

get_latest_successful_build()[source]¶

Identify latest successful build on Jenkins.

Jenkins configuration is determined in data/qed_env.yml.

upgrade_PF(pfSUT)[source]¶

Upgrade PFE to latest successful version/build.

Jenkins configuration is determined in data/qed_env.yml.

Parameters:pfSUT – PathFinder IP or DNS name to upgrade.
Raises:UpgradeError.
